relation: Great for these types of students
Very good campus security including student officers
Although the tuition I'd pretty hefty, i do feel like I really am getting the most for my money. The services that are available at the university are unmatched,

Scranton is a small city with a lot of things to do. There are a lot of restaurants nearby. There is a mall within walking distance of the school. Dickson city, a town close by, has a bowling alley, another mall, more restaurants and a movie theater.
The dinning hall has a variety of foods everyday. There are always healthy choices available and even a gluten free station for those with gluten allergies.
The dorms are beautiful and the bathroom are very clean. There is a housekeeping service included in the room and board charge.
Being a. Biology major, I chose the university over school such as Pitt and temple because of the high acceptance for medical school.

I would suggest getting to know your professors, the professors at the university. The professors at the university take pride in building relationships with their students. I would also suggest joining some clubs to get tot know more people. Also talk to some of the people in your classes. You should even consider making a study group with some of them.

The University is a great place to be. Being a Jesuit university, the faculty and staff are very hands-on and take the time to get to know their students. The environment at Scranton is very friendly.

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck It is a lot of money but if you have the grades they are very generous in their scholarships and in the end you will be paying for quality Will enjoy being here A brand new student center + the city of Scranton + endless activities and clubs = total fun, when your not studying of course! Will learn a lot Freshmen year courses are specifically designed to ready you for your respective major.
